bug.short_desc: Mobile App "Added to Home Screen" (iOS) differs to an instance started with a browser

long_desc.thetext:
On iOS / Safari I opened my Web- App and usrd a tool menu item "Add to Home Screen". Afterwards there is a desktop icon referring the Web- App. You can click on it opening the Web- App in full screen mode. His is because there is a meta entry in the mobile sceleton "index.html" that is very usefull on iOS.
Now there is the diferent behaviour.
Using the Safari browser : If you change into any different application and turn back to the web browser app the content is not changed - like expected.
Opening the Web- App using the referring icon on the desktop: If you change into any different application and turn back to the full screen Web App, it starts again running through the main function of the Application.js including it's initialisation- not expected !

This can not be prevented by qx.Mobile directly. If you want to prevent it, you may pack your app inside a "PhoneGap" container.
By wrapping the application with PhoneGap you can listen to events like "resume" or "idle"
See: http://docs.phonegap.com/en/2.9.0/cordova_events_events.md.html#resume
